intro: Arachnothryx pumae, commonly known as the rough-stemmed arachnothryx, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Arachnothryx pumae thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the tropical ecosystem.
